mechanoreception.notes: As copepods, Canuellidae likely possess mechanoreceptors for detecting water currents and vibrations, crucial for prey detection and predator avoidance. Inferred from general copepod biology.

chemoreception.notes: Copepods, including Canuellidae, likely use chemoreceptors to detect chemical cues in the water, aiding in finding food and mates. Inferred from general copepod biology.

vision.notes: The presence and capabilities of vision in Canuellidae are currently unknown based on available information.
